title: Taverley Dungeon

properties.value: The Taverley Dungeon is one of the largest dungeons in Old School RuneScape. There are many monsters, ranging from low to high combat levels, getting stronger as players venture deeper into the dungeon. These include poisonous monsters, so bringing antipoison potions is advised if travelling through the parts of the dungeon that contain them. Taverley Dungeon is entirely single combat (although cannons can still attack multiple targets if the player is not in direct combat).

Dark Wizards' Tower

The Taverley Dungeon is one of the largest dungeons in Old School RuneScape. There are many monsters, ranging from low to high combat levels, getting stronger as players venture deeper into the dungeon. These include poisonous monsters, so bringing antipoison potions is advised if travelling through the parts of the dungeon that contain them. Taverley Dungeon is entirely single combat (although cannons can still attack multiple targets if the player is not in direct combat).

Contents

  • 1 Location
  • 2 The dusty key
  • 3 Layout
    • 3.1 First half
    • 3.2 Second half
    • 3.3 Upper level
    • 3.4 Shortcuts
  • 4 Monsters
  • 5 Notable personalities
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 Changes

Location[edit | edit source]

The entrance to the dungeon is found south of Taverley and west of Falador. Ways of getting there include:

  • Falador Teleport spell or tablet
  • Teleport to House if your house is in Taverley, or Taverley teleport tablet
  • Burthorpe Games Room Grouping teleport or games necklace to Burthorpe, then run south
  • Explorer's ring 2 or better teleport to the cabbage patch south of Falador
  • Balloon transport system to Taverley
  • The south portal in the Wizards' Guild (requires 66 Magic) of Yanille brings the player to the Dark Wizards' Tower located just south

The dusty key[edit | edit source]

The dusty key is required to access the deeper areas of the dungeon. To obtain it, go through the dungeon headed south to the Kinshra's (Black Knight) headquarters. Go into the narrow eastern passageway, kill the Jailer (level 47), get the jail key he drops, use it to open the door of the southern jail cell, and talk to the prisoner, Velrak the explorer, to get the key. (Players will not get the dusty key if asking for a reward. If this is done, talk to Velrak again and choose the other conversation branch.) Velrak will not leave the cell. If the key is lost, another one can be obtained in the same way.

Note: The drop trick can be used to get more than one key at once.

The dusty key is not tradeable, but it can be purchased in the Legends' Guild shop. A dusty key always spawns deep in the dungeon near the lava eel fishing area. Since this is in the area behind the gate, most players who do not already have a copy of the key cannot reach this area to take this spawn. Players with level 70 Agility can get the key by using the shortcut to the blue dragon area and going south to the lava eel area.

Layout[edit | edit source]

First half[edit | edit source]

Notable features in the first half of the dungeon include:

The chaos druids and their ritual altar.
  • The Cauldron of Thunder, which is used in the Druidic Ritual quest.
  • Chaos dwarves.
  • A black dragon lair containing 12 black dragons and 5 baby black dragons. They are guarded by Slieve, who will only let players kill them if they have a black dragon task.
  • A blue dragon lair containing 12 blue dragons. They are guarded by Eve, who will only let players kill them if they have a blue dragon task.
  • Chaos druids in the north-eastern area of the dungeon.
  • The Kinshra hideout, which houses Lord Daquarius, who is talked to during Wanted!. Velrak the explorer is confined in a cell and gives a dusty key for players to access the remaining half of the dungeon if they do not have the required Agility levels. Players must kill a jailer to obtain a jail key to enter Velrak's cell.
  • A metal door which bars access to the remaining half of the dungeon, which can only be opened with the dusty key (see above).

Second half[edit | edit source]

The magic axes in their domain.

The second half of the dungeon contains much stronger monsters. Access to this area requires a dusty key, or at least 70 Agility to use the obstacle pipe. Notable features include:

  • Blue dragon lair, which contains multiple baby blue dragons and adult blue dragons and several blue dragon scale spawns.
  • Lava eel fishing spots, which are used during Heroes' Quest if not going to the Lava Maze.
  • Black demons.
  • Poison spiders.
  • Hellhounds, in addition to an extra chamber where Cerberus can be fought.
  • Two black dragons.
  • The Obelisk of Fire can be found west of the black dragons.
  • The Obelisk of Water can be found above the ladder near the black dragons, leading to an island off the coast of Catherby with the obelisk on it.

Upper level[edit | edit source]

Blue dragons and their eggs.

The upper level contains blue and black dragons that can only be killed if they are assigned as a slayer task.

  • The black dragon lair, containing 12 black dragons and 5 baby black dragons, can be accessed via a staircase west of the Cauldron of Thunder. They are guarded by Slieve, who will only let players kill them if they have a black dragon task.
  • The blue dragon lair, containing 12 blue dragons, can be accessed via a staircase in the blue dragon area. If players have 70 Agility, they can jump up the rocks opposite the stairs that lead to the black dragons in the upper level. They are guarded by Eve, who will only let players kill them if they have a blue dragon task.

Shortcuts[edit | edit source]

There are four Agility shortcuts located within the dungeon:

  • Squeeze through the loose railing, requiring 63 Agility, between magic axes and lesser demons, still requires a dusty key.
  • Obstacle pipe between the entrance and blue dragons, requires 70 Agility, no dusty key required.
  • Jump over the Strange floor spikes between the entrance and poison spiders, requiring 80 Agility, no dusty key required.
  • The rocks, requiring 70 Agility, north of the obstacle pipe are to the Slayer task-only area upstairs, containing blue dragons, baby black dragons, and black dragons. No dusty key is required for this area.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Baby black dragon
  • Baby blue dragon
  • Black demon
  • Black dragon
  • Black Knight
  • Blue dragon
  • Chaos druid
  • Chaos dwarf
  • Cerberus
  • Magic axe
  • Hellhound
  • Hill Giant
  • Giant bat
  • Jailer
  • Lesser demon
  • Monk of Zamorak
  • Poison spider
  • Poison Scorpion
  • Skeleton
  • Spider
  • Suit of armour
  • Ghost

Notable personalities[edit | edit source]

  • Lord Daquarius
  • Velrak the explorer
  • Kharid Scorpion
  • Slieve
  • Eve

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • This dungeon, along with Brimhaven Dungeon, had its black demon and blue dragon capacity expanded to include Slayer task-only areas, due to their popularity in Slayer tasks, on 10 September 2015.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
10 September 2015
(update)

The blue dragons and black demons found in Taverly[sic] dungeon now have extended areas with some extra spawns.

The '''Taverley Dungeon''' is one of the largest [[dungeons]] in ''[[Old School RuneScape]].'' There are many monsters, ranging from low to high [[combat level]]s, getting stronger as players venture deeper into the dungeon. These include [[poison]]ous monsters, so bringing [[antipoison]] potions is advised if travelling through the parts of the dungeon that contain them. Taverley Dungeon is entirely single combat (although cannons can still attack multiple targets if the player is not in direct combat).

==Location==
The entrance to the dungeon is found south of [[Taverley]] and west of [[Falador]]. Ways of getting there include:

*[[Falador Teleport]] spell or [[Falador teleport|tablet]]
*[[Teleport to House]] if your house is in Taverley, or [[Taverley teleport]] tablet
*[[Burthorpe Games Room]] [[Grouping teleport]] or [[games necklace]] to [[Burthorpe]], then run south
*[[Explorer's ring 2]] or better teleport to the cabbage patch south of Falador
*[[Balloon transport system]] to Taverley
*The south portal in the [[Wizards' Guild]] (requires 66 Magic) of [[Yanille]] brings the player to the [[Dark Wizards' Tower]] located just south

==The dusty key==
The [[dusty key]] is required to access the deeper areas of the dungeon. To obtain it, go through the dungeon headed south to the [[Kinshra]]'s (Black Knight) headquarters. Go into the narrow eastern passageway, kill the [[Jailer]] (level 47), get the [[jail key]] he drops, use it to open the door of the southern jail cell, and talk to the prisoner, [[Velrak the explorer]], to get the key. (Players will not get the dusty key if asking for a reward. If this is done, talk to Velrak again and choose the other conversation branch.) Velrak will not leave the cell. If the key is lost, another one can be obtained in the same way.

Note: The [[drop trick]] can be used to get more than one key at once. 

The dusty key is not tradeable, but it can be purchased in the [[Legends' Guild]] shop. A dusty key always spawns deep in the dungeon near the lava eel fishing area. Since this is in the area behind the gate, most players who do not already have a copy of the key cannot reach this area to take this spawn. Players with level 70 [[Agility]] can get the key by using the shortcut to the blue dragon area and going south to the lava eel area.

==Layout==
===First half===
Notable features in the first half of the dungeon include:
[[File:Taverley Dungeon chaos druids.png|thumb|The chaos druids and their ritual altar.]]
*The [[Cauldron of Thunder]], which is used in the [[Druidic Ritual]] quest.
*[[Chaos dwarf|Chaos dwarves]].
*A [[black dragon]] lair containing 12 black dragons and 5 [[baby black dragon]]s. They are guarded by [[Slieve]], who will only let players kill them if they have a black dragon task.
*A [[blue dragon]] lair containing 12 blue dragons. They are guarded by [[Eve]], who will only let players kill them if they have a blue dragon task.
*[[Chaos druid]]s in the north-eastern area of the dungeon.
*The [[Kinshra]] hideout, which houses [[Lord Daquarius]], who is talked to during [[Wanted!]]. [[Velrak the explorer]] is confined in a cell and gives a [[dusty key]] for players to access the remaining half of the dungeon if they do not have the required Agility levels. Players must kill a [[jailer]] to obtain a [[jail key]] to enter Velrak's cell.
*A metal door which bars access to the remaining half of the dungeon, which can only be opened with the dusty key (see above).

===Second half===
[[File:Taverley Dungeon magic axes.png|thumb|The magic axes in their domain.]]
The second half of the dungeon contains much stronger monsters. Access to this area requires a [[dusty key]], or at least 70 Agility to use the obstacle pipe. Notable features include:

*Blue dragon lair, which contains multiple [[baby blue dragon]]s and adult blue dragons and several [[blue dragon scale]] spawns.
*[[Lava eel]] fishing spots, which are used during [[Heroes' Quest]] if not going to the [[Lava Maze]].
*[[Black demon]]s.
*[[Poison spider]]s.
*[[Hellhound]]s, in addition to an extra chamber where [[Cerberus]] can be fought.
*Two [[black dragon]]s.
*The [[Obelisk of Fire]] can be found west of the black dragons.
*The [[Obelisk of Water]] can be found above the ladder near the black dragons, leading to an island off the coast of [[Catherby]] with the obelisk on it.

===Upper level===
[[File:Taverley Dungeon dragons.png|thumb|Blue dragons and their eggs.]]
The upper level contains [[blue dragon|blue]] and [[black dragon]]s that can only be killed if they are assigned as a [[slayer task]].

*The [[black dragon]] lair, containing 12 black dragons and 5 [[baby black dragon]]s, can be accessed via a staircase west of the [[Cauldron of Thunder]]. They are guarded by [[Slieve]], who will only let players kill them if they have a black dragon task.
*The [[blue dragon]] lair, containing 12 blue dragons, can be accessed via a staircase in the blue dragon area. If players have 70 Agility, they can jump up the rocks opposite the stairs that lead to the black dragons in the upper level. They are guarded by [[Eve]], who will only let players kill them if they have a blue dragon task.

===Shortcuts===
There are four Agility shortcuts located within the dungeon:

*Squeeze through the [[Loose railing (Taverley Dungeon)|loose railing]], requiring 63 [[Agility]], between magic axes and lesser demons, still requires a dusty key.
*[[Obstacle pipe (Taverley Dungeon)|Obstacle pipe]] between the entrance and blue dragons, requires 70 Agility, no dusty key required.
*Jump over the [[Strange floor (Taverley Dungeon)|Strange floor]] spikes between the entrance and poison spiders, requiring 80 Agility, no dusty key required.
*The [[Rocks (Taverley Dungeon)|rocks]], requiring 70 Agility, north of the obstacle pipe are to the [[Slayer]] task-only area upstairs, containing blue dragons, baby black dragons, and black dragons. No dusty key is required for this area.

==Trivia==
*This dungeon, along with [[Brimhaven Dungeon]], had its black demon and blue dragon capacity expanded to include Slayer task-only areas, due to their popularity in Slayer tasks, on [[10 September]] [[2015]].
